messages.subject: Fw: [nihontostudy] Mimi question...
messages.msgSnippet: Remember too that hineri-maki is a popular form of hilt binding... ... From: Barry Thomas To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Saturday, January 20, 2007
messages.messageBody:
Remember too that hineri-maki is a popular form of hilt binding...

----- Original Message -----
From: Barry Thomas
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, January 20, 2007 9:11 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Mimi question...


Hmmm - off the top of my head, "ko"= small or little, "hineri" is a pinch or a twist (term used in aikido), and "kaeri" means a "return" or a turn-back (term used in swords). So, I'm guessing it is a mimi that might be rope-like with small twists with an under-curve like a scraper used in woodwork???? As for a picture...

Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: klepet33319
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, January 20, 2007 7:31 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Mimi question...


Can anyone please explain what 'kohinerikaeshi-mimi' is and/or provide
a picture/link to illustrate?
Thanks much!
Pete Klein
.,_._,___
